Key Match Events: LeBron James finished with 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists to earn his first triple-double of the 2024-25 NBA season.
The Lakers outscored the Kings 44-33 in the fourth quarter, with James shooting 6-of-6 from the field and scoring 16 points in the final frame.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis praised LeBron James for his performance and sustained greatness, noting that the team refused to let him sit when he had the hot hand.
The early returns on first-year head coach JJ Redick are encouraging, with the Lakers' offense playing with much motion and different layers to their actions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers are off to a 3-0 start and sit fifth in offensive rating (120.1).
All five of L.A.'s starters scored at least 16 points against the Kings, and the team went 14-of-34 from beyond the arc.
Kevin O'Connor highlighted that JJ Redick has unlocked Anthony Davis and made a significant difference with a similar roster but a new process.
